prior_works.title: Robust Principal Component Analysis?
prior_works.authors: Emmanuel J. Candès; Xiaodong Li; Yi Ma; John Wright
prior_works.role: Foundational low-rank + sparse decomposition for separating clean structure from corruption
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Deno-IF’s convolutional low-rank optimization module directly adapts the RPCA idea of extracting a clean low-rank component from noisy observations, but retools it into a convolutional/feature-space prior tailored for image fusion inputs.

prior_works.title: Robust Subspace Segmentation by Low-Rank Representation
prior_works.authors: Guangcan Liu; Zhouchen Lin; Yong Yu
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Building on LRR’s principle that data lie in low-dimensional subspaces, Deno-IF leverages a low-rank representation prior (in convolutional form) to guide unsupervised decomposition of clean components from noisy VI/IR images; the optimization and regularization choices echo LRR’s formulation.

prior_works.title: Annihilating Filter-based Low-Rank Hankel Matrix (ALOHA) for Image Restoration
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ALOHA’s Hankel-structured low-rankness formalizes convolutional correlations; Deno-IF’s "convolutional low-rankness" loss borrows this insight to regularize feature maps so that clean, repetitive structures are retained while noise is suppressed.

prior_works.title: Plug-and-Play Priors for Model Based Reconstruction
prior_works.authors: S. Sreehari Venkatakrishnan; Charles A. Bouman; Kenneth D. Sauer
prior_works.role: Using denoisers as implicit regularizers in inverse problems
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The unified denoising–fusion design in Deno-IF follows the PnP philosophy of embedding a denoising prior inside a larger reconstruction task, inspiring the joint intra-/inter-modal recovery where denoising acts as a learnable regularizer for fusion.

prior_works.title: Noise2Noise: Learning Image Restoration without Clean Data
prior_works.role: Unsupervised/self-supervised denoising from noisy inputs only
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Noise2Noise’s core claim—that clean targets are unnecessary—supports Deno-IF’s unsupervised training from only noisy source images; Deno-IF extends this idea by injecting a convolutional low-rank prior to obtain clean components that guide fusion.

prior_works.title: DenseFuse: A Fusion Approach to Infrared and Visible Images
prior_works.role: Unsupervised autoencoder-based IR–visible fusion with reconstruction/structure losses
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Deno-IF inherits the unsupervised fusion paradigm from DenseFuse (reconstruction-driven training without ground-truth fused targets) but advances it by jointly integrating denoising and adding a convolutional low-rankness regularizer.

prior_works.title: U2Fusion: A Unified Unsupervised Image Fusion Network
prior_works.role: General unified unsupervised fusion framework across modalities
prior_works.relationship_sentence: U2Fusion’s unified, modality-agnostic unsupervised training inspires Deno-IF’s single network that performs intra-modal recovery and inter-modal fusion; Deno-IF further extends this with explicit noise handling via low-rank priors and a joint denoising-fusion objective.

synthesis_narrative:
Deno-IF’s core innovation—unsupervised noisy IR–visible fusion via a convolutional low-rank decomposition and a unified denoising–fusion network—rests on two intertwined lines of prior work. First, classic low-rank modeling (RPCA and LRR) established that clean structure can be isolated from corruption by enforcing low-rankness. Deno-IF adapts this principle to the convolutional/feature domain, aligning with Hankel/ALOHA-style insights that convolutionally lifted representations become low rank for structured signals. This directly motivates both the optimization module that extracts clean components from only noisy inputs and the explicit convolutional low-rankness loss that stabilizes training.
Second, unsupervised learning for restoration and fusion demonstrated that paired clean/fused targets are unnecessary. Noise2Noise showed denoising can be learned from noisy observations alone, while DenseFuse and U2Fusion pioneered unsupervised IR–visible fusion with reconstruction/structure constraints. Deno-IF synthesizes these by learning from noisy sources, but unlike prior fusion networks, it couples intra-modal recovery (denoising) and inter-modal fusion within a single architecture, guided by a principled low-rank prior. Finally, the Plug-and-Play paradigm informs the systemic integration of denoising as a regularizer inside a larger inverse task, mirroring Deno-IF’s joint design where denoising and fusion mutually reinforce each other. Together, these works directly scaffold Deno-IF’s two key modules: convolutional low-rank decomposition without supervision, and an efficient unified network that simultaneously denoises and fuses under a low-rankness constraint.
